chapter.label: Chapter1
chapter.para: Baltimore City Department of Legislative Reference
The Mayor and City Council of Baltimore
For information – call, write, or fax:
“I” to “IX”=Articles I to IX of the Baltimore City Charter
“1” to “31” =Articles 1 to 31 of the Baltimore City Code
“BFR”* =Building, Fire, and Related Codes Article of the Baltimore City Revised Code, comprising the following codes:
“BC” = Building Code (Modifications to Int’l Building Code/2012)
“ECC-C”=Energy Conservation Code - Commercial (Modifications to Int’l Energy Conservation Code/2012)
“ECC-R”=Energy Conservation Code - Residential (Modifications to Int’l Energy Conservation Code/2012)
“FGC”=Fuel Gas Code (Modifications to Int’l Fuel Gas Code/2012)
“PMC” = =Property Maintenance Code (Modifications to Int’l Property Maintenance Code/2012)
“RC”=Residential Code of Baltimore City (Modifications to Int’l Residential Code,
“He”=Health Article of the Baltimore City Revised Code
“Zg” =Zoning Article of the Baltimore City Revised Code
“PLL” =Code of Public Local Laws of Baltimore City

*Note on BFR Codes: The City’s Building, Fire, and Related Codes Article comprises the national codes listed here, subject to a number of local modifications. As to these adopted codes, this Glossary encompasses only the definitions that have been locally modified or added.
See also Motor fuel service stn
Junk or scrap storage and yardsZg1-153.1
Restaurant – including live entertainment or dancingZg1-182.2
Tavern – including live entertainment or dancingZg1-194.2
“With most any legislation, let anybody else do the drafting — any way his [or her] heart desires. Just be sure that you get to do the definitions.”
